CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 26, 1954, page 5, reads: "Fears Lynching - Dave Brooks, 66, of Brackenridge, tells his attorneys, Richard F. Jones and Henry R. Smith Jr., that he fears he will be lynched if Pennsylvania authorities return him to Georgia to answer charges of assaulting a bullying police officer. Brooks' fears were substantiated by several of his neighbors who raised money to legally defend the elderly man since they know the type of justice in their native state. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Attorney Richard F. Jones, Dave Brooks, and Attorney Henry R. Smith Jr., standing in front of marble wall
CatSubject_tab: Group portraits--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Men--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Interiors--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Attorneys--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Jones, Richard F.Smith, Henry R. Jr.
